member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.Client.FabricTransportServiceRemotingClientFactory
member.summary: An that uses Fabric TCP transport to create that communicate with stateless and stateful services over interfaces that are remoted via .

member.name: E:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.Client.FabricTransportServiceRemotingClientFactory.ClientConnected
member.summary: Event handler that is fired when a client is connected to the service endpoint.

member.name: E:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.Client.FabricTransportServiceRemotingClientFactory.ClientDisconnected
member.summary: Event handler that is fired when a client is disconnected from the service endpoint.
Constructs a fabric transport based service remoting client factory.
member.param: The settings for the fabric transport. If the settings are not provided or null, default settings with no security.
The callback client that receives the callbacks from the service.
Service partition resolver to resolve the service endpoints. If not specified, a default service partition resolver returned by is used.
Exception handlers to handle the exceptions encountered in communicating with the service.
Id to use in diagnostics traces from this component.
member.remarks: This factory uses an internal fabric transport exception handler to handle exceptions at the fabric TCP transport level and a , in addition to the exception handlers supplied to the constructor.

member.param: Uri of the service to resolve
Key that identifies the partition to resolve
Specifies which replica in the partition identified by the partition key, the client should connect to
Specifies which listener in the endpoint of the chosen replica, to which the client should connect to
Specifies the retry policy that should be used for exceptions that occur when creating the client.
Cancellation token
member.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation. The result of the Task is the CommunicationClient() object.

member.param: Previous ResolvedServicePartition value
Specifies which replica in the partition identified by the partition key, the client should connect to
Specifies which listener in the endpoint of the chosen replica, to which the client should connect to
Specifies the retry policy that should be used for exceptions that occur when creating the client.
Cancellation token
member.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation. The result of the Task is the CommunicationClient() object.

member.summary: Handles the exceptions that occur in the CommunicationClient when sending a message to the Service
member.param: Communication client
Information about exception that happened while communicating with the service.
Specifies the retry policy that should be used for handling the reported exception.
Cancellation token
member.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation. The result of the Task is a object that provides information on retry policy for this exception.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.FabricTransportRemotingSettings
member.summary: Settings that configures the FabricTransport communication.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.FabricTransportRemotingSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new FabricTransportRemotingSettings with default Values.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.FabricTransportRemotingSettings.OperationTimeout
member.summary: Operation Timeout which governs the whole process of sending a message, including receiving a reply message for a request/reply service operation. This timeout also applies when sending reply messages from a callback contract method.
member.remarks: Default Value for Operation Timeout is set as 5 mins

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.FabricTransportRemotingSettings.KeepAliveTimeout
member.summary: KeepAliveTimeout is provides a way to configure Tcp keep-alive option.
member.remarks: Default Value for KeepAliveTimeout Timeout is set as TimeSpan.Zero. which indicates we disable the tcp keepalive option. If you are using loadbalancer , you may need to configure this in order to avoid the loadbalancer to close the connection after certain time

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.FabricTransportRemotingSettings.ConnectTimeout
member.summary: Connect timeout specifies the maximum time allowed for the connection to be established successfully.
member.remarks: Default Value for ConnectTimeout Timeout is set as 5 seconds.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.FabricTransportRemotingSettings.MaxMessageSize
member.summary: MaxMessageSize represents the maximum size for a message that can be received on a channel configured with this setting.
member.value: Maximum size of the message in bytes.
member.remarks: Default Value for MaxMessageSize used is 4194304 bytes

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.FabricTransportRemotingSettings.MaxQueueSize
member.summary: The maximum size, of a queue that stores messages while they are processed for an endpoint configured with this setting.
member.value: Max Size for a Queue that recieves messages from the channel
member.remarks: Default value is 10,000 messages

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.FabricTransportRemotingSettings.MaxConcurrentCalls
member.summary: MaxConcurrentCalls represents maximum number of messages actively service processes at one time.
member.value: MaxConcurrentCalls is the upper limit of active messages in the service.
member.remarks: Default value for the MaxConcurrentCalls is 16*Number of processors.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.FabricTransportRemotingSettings.SecurityCredentials
member.summary: Security credentials for securing the communication
member.remarks: Default Value for SecurityCredentials is None SecurityCredential can be of type x509SecurityCredentail or WindowsCredentials

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.FabricTransportRemotingSettings.LoadFrom(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Loads the FabricTransport settings from a sectionName specified in the configuration file Configuration File can be specified using the filePath or using the name of the configuration package specified in the service manifest . It will first try to load config using configPackageName . if configPackageName is not specified then try to load from filePath.
member.param: Name of the section within the configuration file. If not found section in configuration file, it will throw ArgumentException

Full path of the file where the settings will be loaded from. If not specified , it will first try to load from default Config Package"Config" , if not found then load from Settings "ClientExeName.Settings.xml" present in Client Exe directory.
Name of the configuration package.If its null or empty,it will check for file in filePath
member.returns: FabricTransportRemotingSettings
member.remarks:
The following are the parameter names that should be provided in the configuration file,to be recognizable by service fabric to load the transport settings.
1. MaxQueueSize - value in long. 2. MaxMessageSize - value in bytes. 3. MaxConcurrentCalls - value in long. 4. SecurityCredentials - value. 5. OperationTimeoutInSeconds - value in seconds. 6. KeepAliveTimeoutInSeconds - value in seconds.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.FabricTransportRemotingSettings.TryLoadFrom(System.String,Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.FabricTransportRemotingSettings@,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Try to load the FabricTransport settings from a sectionName specified in the configuration file. Configuration File can be specified using the filePath or using the name of the configuration package specified in the service manifest . It will first try to load config using configPackageName . if configPackageName is not specified then try to load from filePath.
member.param: Name of the section within the configuration file. If not found section in configuration file, it return false

Full path of the file where the settings will be loaded from. If not specified , it will first try to load from default Config Package"Config" , if not found then load from Settings "ClientExeName.Settings.xml" present in Client Exe directory.
Name of the configuration package. If its null or empty,it will check for file in filePath
When this method returns it sets the settings if load from Config succeeded. If fails ,its sets settings to null/>
member.returns: specifies whether the settings get loaded successfully from Config. It returns true when load from Config succeeded, else return false.
member.remarks:
The following are the parameter names that should be provided in the configuration file,to be recognizable by service fabric to load the transport settings.
1. MaxQueueSize - value in long. 2. MaxMessageSize - value in bytes. 3. MaxConcurrentCalls - value in long. 4. SecurityCredentials - value. 5. OperationTimeoutInSeconds - value in seconds. 6. KeepAliveTimeoutInSeconds - value in seconds.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.FabricTransportRemotingSettings.GetDefault(System.String)
member.summary: FabricTransportRemotingSettings returns the default Settings .Loads the configuration file from default Config Package"Config" , if not found then try to load from default config file "ClientExeName.Settings.xml" from Client Exe directory.
member.param: Name of the section within the configuration file. If not found section in configuration file, it will return the default Settings

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.Runtime.FabricTransportRemotingListenerSettings
member.summary: Settings that configures the FabricTransport Listener.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.Runtime.FabricTransportRemotingListenerSettings.EndpointResourceName
member.summary: EndpointResourceName is name of the endpoint resource specified in ServiceManifest .This is used to obtain the port number on which to service will listen.
member.value: EndpointResourceName is name of the endpoint resource defined in the service manifest.
member.remarks: Default value of EndpointResourceName is "ServiceEndpoint"

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.Runtime.FabricTransportRemotingListenerSettings.OperationTimeout
member.summary: Operation Timeout which governs the whole process of sending a message, including receiving a reply message for a request/reply service operation. This timeout also applies when sending reply messages from a callback contract method.
member.remarks: Default Value for Operation Timeout is set as 5 mins

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.Runtime.FabricTransportRemotingListenerSettings.KeepAliveTimeout
member.summary: KeepAliveTimeout is provides a way to configure Tcp keep-alive option.
member.remarks: Default Value for KeepAliveTimeout Timeout is set as TimeSpan.Zero. which indicates we disable the tcp keepalive option. If you are using loadbalancer , you may need to configure this in order to avoid the loadbalancer to close the connection after certain time

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.Runtime.FabricTransportRemotingListenerSettings.MaxMessageSize
member.summary: MaxMessageSize represents the maximum size for a message that can be received on a channel configured with this setting.
member.value: Maximum size of the message in bytes.
member.remarks: Default Value for MaxMessageSize used is 4194304 bytes

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.Runtime.FabricTransportRemotingListenerSettings.MaxQueueSize
member.summary: The maximum size, of a queue that stores messages while they are processed for an endpoint configured with this setting.
member.value: Max Size for a Queue that recieves messages from the channel
member.remarks: Default value is 10,000 messages

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.Runtime.FabricTransportRemotingListenerSettings.MaxConcurrentCalls
member.summary: MaxConcurrentCalls represents maximum number of messages actively service processes at one time.
member.value: MaxConcurrentCalls is the upper limit of active messages in the service.
member.remarks: Defaults value for the MaxConcurrentCalls is to the Number of processors.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.Runtime.FabricTransportRemotingListenerSettings.SecurityCredentials
member.summary: Security credentials for securing the communication
member.remarks: Default Value for SecurityCredentials is None SecurityCredential can be of type x509SecurityCredentail or WindowsCredentials

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.Runtime.FabricTransportRemotingListenerSettings.LoadFrom(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Loads the FabricTransport settings from a section specified in the service settings configuration file - settings.xml
member.param: Name of the section within the configuration file. if not found , it throws ArgumentException.
Name of the configuration package. if not found Settings.xml in the configuration package path, it throws ArgumentException. If not specified, default name is "Config"
member.returns: FabricTransportRemotingListenerSettings
member.remarks:
The following are the parameter names that should be provided in the configuration file,to be recognizable by service fabric to load the transport settings.
1. MaxQueueSize - value in long. 2. MaxMessageSize - value in bytes. 3. MaxConcurrentCalls - value in long. 4. SecurityCredentials - value. 5. OperationTimeoutInSeconds - value in seconds. 6. KeepAliveTimeoutInSeconds - value in seconds.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.Runtime.FabricTransportRemotingListenerSettings.TryLoadFrom(System.String,Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.Runtime.FabricTransportRemotingListenerSettings@,System.String)
member.summary: Try to load the FabricTransport settings from a section specified in the service settings configuration file - settings.xml
member.param: Name of the section within the configuration file. if not found , it return false
Name of the configuration package. if not found Settings.xml in the configuration package path, it return false. If not specified, default name is "Config"
When this method returns it sets the listenersettings if load from Config succeeded. If fails ,its sets listenerSettings to null/>
member.returns: specifies whether the settings get loaded successfully from Config. It returns true when load from Config succeeded, else return false.
member.remarks:
The following are the parameter names that should be provided in the configuration file,to be recognizable by service fabric to load the transport settings.
1. MaxQueueSize - value in long. 2. MaxMessageSize - value in bytes. 3. MaxConcurrentCalls - value in long. 4. SecurityCredentials - value. 5. OperationTimeoutInSeconds - value in seconds. 6. KeepAliveTimeoutInSeconds - value in seconds.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.Runtime.FabricTransportRemotingListenerSettings.GetDefault(System.String)
member.summary: FabricTransportRemotingListenerSettings returns the default Settings .Loads the configuration file from default Config Package"Config" .
member.param: Name of the section within the configuration file. If not found section in configuration file, it will return the default Settings

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.Runtime.FabricTransportServiceRemotingListener.Microsoft#ServiceFabric#Services#Communication#Runtime#ICommunicationListener#OpenAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: This method causes the communication listener to be opened. Once the Open completes, the communication listener becomes usable - accepts and sends messages.
member.param: Cancellation token
member.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation. The result of the Task is the endpoint string.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.Runtime.FabricTransportServiceRemotingListener.Microsoft#ServiceFabric#Services#Communication#Runtime#ICommunicationListener#CloseAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: This method causes the communication listener to close. Close is a terminal state and this method allows the communication listener to transition to this state in a graceful manner.
member.param: Cancellation token
member.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.Runtime.FabricTransportServiceRemotingListener.Microsoft#ServiceFabric#Services#Communication#Runtime#ICommunicationListener#Abort
member.summary: This method causes the communication listener to close. Close is a terminal state and this method causes the transition to close ungracefully. Any outstanding operations (including close) should be canceled when this method is called.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.FabricTransportServiceRemotingProviderAttribute
member.summary: Sets Fabric TCP transport as the default service remoting transport provider in the assembly.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.FabricTransportServiceRemotingProviderAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a which can be used to set Fabric TCP transport as the default service remoting transport provider in the assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.FabricTransportServiceRemotingProviderAttribute.MaxMessageSize
member.summary: Gets or Sets the maximum size of the remoting message in bytes. If value for this property is not specified or it is less than or equals to zero, a default value of 4,194,304 bytes (4 MB) is used.
member.value: The maximum size of the remoting message in bytes. If this value is not specified or it is less than or equals to zero, a default value of 4,194,304 bytes (4 MB) is used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.FabricTransportServiceRemotingProviderAttribute.OperationTimeoutInSeconds
member.summary:
Gets or Sets the operation timeout in seconds. If the operation is not completed in the specified time, it will be timed out. By default, exception handler of
retries the timed out exception. It is recommended to not change the operation timeout from it's default value.
member.value: The operation timeout in seconds. If not specified or less than zero, default operation timeout of maximum value is used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.FabricTransportServiceRemotingProviderAttribute.KeepAliveTimeoutInSeconds
member.summary: Gets or Sets the keep alive timeout in seconds. This settings is useful in the scenario when the client and service are connected via load balancer that closes the connection if it is idle for some time. If keep alive timeout is configured, the connection will be kept alive by sending ping messages at that interval.
member.value: The keep alive timeout in seconds.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.FabricTransport.FabricTransportServiceRemotingProviderAttribute.ConnectTimeoutInMilliseconds
member.summary: Gets or Sets the connect timeout in milliseconds. This settings specifies the maximum time allowed for the connection to be established.
member.remarks: Default Value for ConnectTimeout Timeout is 5 seconds.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.Client.ServiceRemotingExceptionHandler
member.summary: This class provide handling of exceptions encountered in communicating with a service fabric service over remoted interfaces.
member.remarks:
The exceptions are handled as per the description below:
The following exceptions indicate service failover. These exceptions are handled by returning from the method. The property of the is set to false, the property is set to a random value up to and property is set to .
, when the target replica is .
The following exceptions indicate transient error conditions and handled by returning from the method. The property of the is set to true, the property is set to a random value up to and property is set to .

member.summary: Method that examines the exception and determines how that exception can be handled.
member.param: Information about the exception
The operation retry preferences.
Result of the exception handling
member.returns: true if the exception is handled, false otherwise

member.summary: The service partition client used to send requests to the service.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.Client.IServiceProxyFactory
member.summary: Specifies the interface for the factory that creates proxies for remote communication to the specified service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.Client.IServiceProxyFactory.CreateServiceProxy``1(System.Uri,Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Client.ServicePartitionKey,Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.TargetReplicaSelector,System.String)
member.summary:
Creates a proxy to communicate to the specified service using the remoted interface TServiceInterface that the service implements. Interface that is being remoted Uri of the Service. The Partition key that determines which service partition is responsible for handling requests from this service proxy Determines which replica or instance of the service partition the client should connect to. This parameter is Optional if the service has a single communication listener. The endpoints from the service are of the form {"Endpoints":{"Listener1":"Endpoint1","Listener2":"Endpoint2" ...}}. When the service exposes multiple endpoints, this parameter identifies which of those endpoints to use for the remoting communication.
The proxy that implement the interface that is being remoted. The returned object also implement interface.

member.summary: Defines the interface that must be implemented to provide a client for Service Remoting communication.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.ServiceRemotingProviderAttribute
member.summary: This is a base type for attribute that sets the default service remoting provider to use for remoting the service interfaces defined and used in the assembly.

remarks.para:
On service side, implementation of this attribute is looked up by and
methods on the runtime to create a default for the stateful and stateless services.
On client side, implementation of this attribute is looked up by constructor to create a default when it is not specified.

Note that on client side
method create a default once and hence the provider lookup happens only for the first time, after which the same provider is used.

The order in which this attribute is looked up is as follows:
In the entry obtained by calling method
In the that defines the remote interface for which listener or proxy is being created.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to CallBack Channel Not Found for this ClientId : '{0}'.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Failed to deserialize and get remote exception {0}.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The exception {0} was unhandled on the service and could not be serialized for transferring to the client..

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.SR.ErrorExceptionSerializationFailed2
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Detailed Exception Information: {0}.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.SR.ErrorHeaderAlreadyExists
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Header with name '{0}' already exists.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.SR.ErrorInterfaceNotImplemented
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Interface id '{0}' is not implemented by object '{1}'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.SR.ErrorInvalidAddress
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Client is trying to connect to invalid address {0}..

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.SR.ErrorMethodNotImplemented
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The object of type '{0}' does support the method '{1}'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.SR.ErrorNoServiceInterfaceFound
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The service type '{0}' does not implement any service interfaces or one of the interfaces implemented is not a service interface. All interfaces(including its parent interface) implemented by service type must be service interface. A service interface is the one that ultimately derives from '{1}' type..

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.SR.ErrorNotAServiceInterface_DerivationCheck1
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The type '{0}' is not an service interface as it does not derive from the interface '{1}'..

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.SR.ErrorNotAServiceInterface_DerivationCheck2
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The type '{0}' is not an service interface as it derive from a non service interface '{1}'. All service interfaces must derive from '{2}'..

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.SR.ErrorNotAServiceInterface_InterfaceCheck
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The type '{0}' is not a service interface as it is not an interface. .

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.SR.ErrorRemotedInterfaceIsGeneric
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The {0} interface '{1}' is using generics. Generic interfaces cannot be remoted..

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.SR.ErrorRemotedMethodCancellationTokenOutOfOrder
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Method '{1}' of {0} interface '{2}' has '{4}' parameter '{3}', and it is not the last parameter. If a method of the {0} interface has parameter of type '{4}' it must be the last parameter..

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.SR.ErrorRemotedMethodDoesNotReturnTask
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Method '{1}' of {0} interface '{2}' does not return Task or Task<>. The {0} interface methods must be async and must return either Task or Task<>..

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.SR.ErrorRemotedMethodDoesNotReturnVoid
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Method '{1}' of {0} interface '{2}' returns '{3}'. The {0} interface methods must have a return of type '{4}'..

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.SR.ErrorRemotedMethodHasGenerics
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Method '{1}' of {0} interface '{2}' is using generics. The {0} interface methods cannot use generics..

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.SR.ErrorRemotedMethodHasOutRefOptionalParameter
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Method '{1}' of {0} interface '{2}' has out/ref/optional parameter '{3}'. The {0} interface methods must not have out, ref or optional parameters..

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.SR.ErrorRemotedMethodHasVaArgParameter
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Method '{1}' of {0} interface '{2}' has variable length parameter '{3}'. The {0} interface methods must not have variable length parameters..

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.SR.ErrorRemotedMethodHasVaArgs
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Method '{1}' of {0} interface '{2}' is using a variable argument list. The {0} interface methods cannot have a variable argument list..

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Remoting.SR.ErrorRemotedMethodsIsOverloaded
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Method '{1}' of {0} interface '{2}' is overloaded. The {0} interface methods cannot be overloaded..
